results.content:
Here is a structured extraction of key facts, entities, concepts, and actionable insights from the document.

Document summary
- Title/Program: The Advisor Collaborative
- Tagline: Elevate Your Practice | Transform Your Client’s Experience
- Company: Activ8 Consulting
- Platform/Offering: ProjectWE (virtual platform)
- Core message: A collaborative, capability-building approach and platform for advisors and their clients to improve trust, decision-making, and outcomes across individuals, families, and organizations.

Primary stakeholders and audiences
- Clients (including families; emphasis on multi-generational trust and family dynamics)
- Advisors (e.g., family advisors, wealth advisors)
- Teams/Organizations (advisor firms and their internal teams)
- Advisor community (peer network)
- Provider: Activ8 Consulting (facilitator and platform licensor)

Key benefits by stakeholder
- Client benefits:
  - Clarity of what matters most
  - Break through belief barriers
  - Make decisions with pace
  - Healthier family dynamics
  - Create ambition and accountability
- Advisor benefits:
  - Increase trust across generations
  - Respond to client needs
  - Develop new capabilities
  - Create a roadmap for success
  - Differentiate in the marketplace
- Team/Organization benefits:
  - Develop new capabilities
  - Improve client outcomes
  - Adapt to disruption
  - Deepen services and offers
  - Increase capability to collaborate

Support and platform features (ProjectWE)
- Client and advisor support:
  - Personalized dashboard
  - Roadmap
  - Education and training
  - Practice builder
- Community and licensing:
  - Advisor community
  - License virtual platform

Consulting approach and methodology (Activ8)
- Understand: Assess current situation and growth/innovation areas
- Co-create and customize
- Four activation phases:
  - Engage: Focus on what matters most and why
  - Ignite: Accelerate new capabilities
  - Learn: See new possibilities and take new actions
  - Empower: Unleash the collective potential

Concepts and frameworks referenced
- People, Process, Structure (operating model focus areas)
- Human dimensions (inferred from graphic text):
  - Body, Emotion, Intellect, Purpose, Center, Meaning
  - Likely a holistic framework for personal and relational development (inferred; not fully explained)
- “Powered by you” (service mark indicated as SM)

Evidence/validation
- Testimonial (Family Advisor):
  - Outcome: Changed approach to client collaboration; deepened trust and communication
- No quantitative metrics or case studies provided in the document

Named entities and contact details
- Company: Activ8 Consulting (brand: Activ8)
- Program: The Advisor Collaborative
- Platform: ProjectWE
- Principal contact: Erik Gabrielson
  - Phone: 612.747.7556
  - Email: erik@activ8-u.com
  - Website: www.activ8-u.com

What this offering appears to solve
- Builds cross-generational trust and healthier family dynamics
- Accelerates decision-making and ambition with accountability
- Equips advisors and teams with new capabilities and collaboration tools
- Provides a structured roadmap and training with a virtual platform

Actionable insights and recommended next steps
- For advisors/firms:
  - Identify priority clients or families where trust-building and decision acceleration are needed
  - Baseline current client outcomes (trust, decision speed, family dynamics, collaboration) to measure change
  - Pilot ProjectWE with 1–3 client families and a small internal team
  - Map internal roles to People–Process–Structure and assign owners for Engage–Ignite–Learn–Empower phases
  - Join/assess the advisor community for peer learning and best practices
  - Build a differentiation narrative around cross-generational trust and collaboration
- For Activ8 engagement readiness:
  - Clarify desired capabilities to develop (e.g., facilitation, family governance, conflict resolution)
  - Define success metrics (e.g., NPS, meeting cadence, time-to-decision, intergenerational engagement)
  - Schedule an assessment with Activ8 to tailor the roadmap and training plan

Gaps and open questions (missing details)
- No pricing, contract terms, or implementation timelines
- No security/compliance details for the virtual platform
- No explicit target segments (e.g., RIAs, MFOs, SFOs, family enterprise advisors)
- No quantified outcomes or

Below is a concise strategy readout focused on themes, competitive advantages, market opportunities, and business model implications inferred from the content.

Strategic themes
- Human-centered advisory: Explicit focus on “what matters most,” purpose/meaning, and family dynamics positions the offer beyond financial planning into alignment, trust, and decision velocity.
- Capability building + enablement: The Engage–Ignite–Learn–Empower journey, plus People–Process–Structure framing, signals a repeatable capability-development system for advisors and client families.
- Platform + services flywheel: Dual engine of ProjectWE (platform: dashboards,

Below is an actionable, end-to-end implementation guide to operationalize “The Advisor Collaborative” and the ProjectWE approach in your practice. It converts the concepts (Engage, Ignite, Learn, Empower; People, Process, Structure; client/advisor/team benefits) into concrete steps, workflows, tools, and measurable outcomes.

1) Objectives and success criteria
- Primary outcomes to deliver for clients
  - Clarity of what matters most (values, purpose, priorities)
  - Break through belief barriers (limiting assumptions)
  - Make decisions with pace (clear decision rights and cadence)
  - Healthier family dynamics (communication, conflict norms)
  - Ambition and accountability (goals and follow-through)
- Primary outcomes for the practice
  - Increase trust across generations
  - Differentiate your offering
  - Develop new capabilities and deepen services
  - Improve collaboration internally and with partners
- Define 90-day pilot targets (examples)
  - 3–5 client families enrolled
  - Baseline and post scores improve by 20% in clarity/decision pace
  - Two cross-generational meetings run per family
  - At least one belief barrier identified and addressed per family
  - NPS +20 and 80%+ meeting usefulness ratings

2) Program architecture and timeline
- Phase 0: Setup and enablement (2–4 weeks)
- Phase 1: Engage (weeks 1–4)
- Phase 2: Ignite (weeks 5–8)
- Phase 3: Learn (weeks 9–12)
- Phase 4: Empower and scale (months 4–12)

3) Phase 0: Setup and enablement
3.1 Governance and roles
- Program sponsor (lead advisor or principal)
- Program manager (operations lead)
- Lead facilitator (you or trained advisor)
- Analyst/coordinator (data, scheduling, notes)
- Confidentiality and consent lead (compliance)

3.2 Measurement framework
- Baseline and post surveys (sample scales 1–10)
  - Clarity of priorities
  - Speed of decision-making
  - Trust across generations
  - Family communication comfort
  - Accountability follow-through
- Behavioral KPIs
  - Time-to-decision (request to decision)
  - Number of cross-gen meetings held
  - Commitments completed on time
  - Conflicts resolved within agreed SLA
- Business KPIs
  - NPS, retention, share of wallet, referrals
  - Time spent per case vs outcomes achieved

3.3 Tooling and platform
- If using ProjectWE
  - Provision personalized dashboards per family
  - Install roadmap template and practice builder
  - Assign education/training modules to internal staff
  - Join advisor community; set monthly learning goals
- If not yet licensed, minimum viable stack
  - Collaboration: Zoom/Teams + Miro/Mural for workshops
  - Client portal: ShareFile/Box/Drive (secure folders per family)
  - CRM: Wealthbox/Redtail/HubSpot or Salesforce (custom fields)
  - Workflow: Asana/Monday (roadmap, commitments)
  - Survey: Typeform/Google Forms (pre/post and pulse checks)
  - Dashboard: Notion/Airtable/Power BI (metrics and progress)

3.4 Core templates to prepare
- Client intake and consent form (including cross-gen permissions)
- Values/Purpose Discovery Guide
- Relationship and Stakeholder Map
- Belief Barrier Inventory + Reframe Worksheet
- Decision Charter (RAPID or DACI) + Timebox policy
- Family Meeting Charter (rules, confidentiality, norms)
- Roadmap and OKR/quarterly plan
- After Action Review (AAR) form
- Weekly Accountability Check-in form
- Program dashboard fields (see Section 6)

4) Client journey and facilitation playbook
Phase

Synthesis: what this really is
- This reframes “advice” from giving answers to building a shared decision-making system. The core product isn’t information; it’s a repeatable collaboration capability across client, advisor, and family that compounds trust, decision velocity, and adaptability.
- The method blends tech (dashboards, roadmaps), facilitation (Engage, Ignite, Learn, Empower), and community. It integrates emotion and intellect around purpose, then institutionalizes it via people/process/structure.

Hidden patterns and flywheels
- Dual-sided capability loop: The same capabilities (clarity, belief-busting, decision cadence) are built in both client and advisor. As clients improve outcomes, advisors differentiate and expand services, which funds more capability building—trust and results compound.
- Emotion x Intellect x Purpose: Anchoring decisions in “what matters most” converts emotional energy into aligned execution.
